alert.note: Alert for Kent; Queen Anne's (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 10:25PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Queen Anne`s and western Kent Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1025 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rock Hall, or 11 miles northwest of Centerville, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chestertown, Rock Hall, Newtown, Old Town, Langford and Kingstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northeastern Maryland.
